subject: Dbus Based Gpio Event monitoring
commitMessage:
Dbus Based Gpio Event monitoring

This change provide the implementation for D-bus based Gpio Event monitoring.
For the platform not having direct GPIO access can use dbus based event
monitor by configuring dbus names in Json file. x86-power-control will monitor
the property change from the given DbusName and take appropriate action

Updated parsing logic of reading config values from json.

TESTED:Tested and verified in Tiogapass and YosemteV2. The existing functionality
is not broken after adding the JSON parser implementation in Tiogapass.

Signed-off-by: Priyatharshan P <priyatharshanp@hcl.com>
Change-Id: I480c62eccebf6d0a3c4609afaf24d55265d99602

Patch Set 9:

(2 comments)

I think this may have introduced a bug - I'm seeing that these interfaces are not activatable because the service path includes the node number.

Patch Set 9:

To be specific, I'm seeing the follow messages repeatedly with the hosts not booting up:
```
busctl[1342]: Failed to get property OperatingSystemState on interface xyz.openbmc_project.State.OperatingSystem.Status: The name is not activatable
busctl[1354]: Failed to get property CurrentPowerState on interface xyz.openbmc_project.State.Chassis: The name is not activatable
```

Should I create a github issue?

Patch Set 9:

> Patch Set 9:
> 
> To be specific, I'm seeing the follow messages repeatedly with the hosts not booting up:
> ```
> busctl[1342]: Failed to get property OperatingSystemState on interface xyz.openbmc_project.State.OperatingSystem.Status: The name is not activatable
> busctl[1354]: Failed to get property CurrentPowerState on interface xyz.openbmc_project.State.Chassis: The name is not activatable
> ```
> 
> Should I create a github issue?

This is an expected behaviour with this change. The change added support for multiple hosts

a separate power control instance is created for respective host with a separate dbus service name with numbering at the end.

The new change creates dbus service names as below

example 
single host : xyz.openbmc_project.State.Host0 instead of xyz.openbmc_project.State.Host

multiple hosts :
xyz.openbmc_project.State.Host1
xyz.openbmc_project.State.Host2
xyz.openbmc_project.State.Host3
..
xyz.openbmc_project.State.HostN

so wherever we use service name lookups should add number zero at the end of dbus name to solve the issue.


currently the workaround to remove the numbering for single host is added below

https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/x86-power-control/+/45004
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/openbmc/+/45178


This change keeps the dbus service names without number zero for single hosts .

i.e xyz.openbmc_project.State.Host

any way in the long run it would be ideal if we adapt Host0 for single host dbus service names
I'm not sure if it's possible, but it might be good if we can separate out the GPIO and D-Bus behavior in the code.  Perhaps using .hpp files?  It may help with readability of the code.
Ack

std::get can throw, so I'd suggest either wrapping a try (which I think msg.read() can also throw, so they could be together), or use std::get_if instead.

If you change this to !=, you can return and reduce the scope indentation of the remaining code. Same below.

Be careful with arg0namespace as it will match anything with the base of dbusName.

For example, if you set the match on arg0namespace of 'xyz.openbmc_project.Button.Power', you would get matches on 'xyz.openbmc_project.Button.Power.*' which could match more than you expect.

If you really only want to match the exact interface, then you can use 'arg0' instead of 'arg0namespace'.
Done
This will throw on anything that isn't an int.  Either a try or std::get_if() may be better.
Done
Real type here instead of auto would still be nice.

nit: It's better to keep try blocks small, so I think the catch could be moved up to 2474 after the std::get call as it doesn't look like there are any further exceptions after that.

Should "chassisDbusName" be used instead which includes the node number?
